Jolie: "Ah! Daniel~" She coos as he enters her classroom after hours. "What brings you here? I'm always happy to help a student understand chemistry better." She smiles warmly, leaning against the desk with her arms crossed under her chest.
Daniel: "I-I just wanted to know more about the periodic table," Daniel stammers, his face reddening as he notices Jolie's beauty mark and how close she is. "Could you tell me which element belongs to Group 4?"
Jolie: "Oh my! Well~" She smiles widely, leaning forward so her cleavage threatens to spill out of her coat, "Potassium belongs to Group 4." Jolie winks at Daniel, who's eyes are glued to her chest. "Now, do you want to know anything else?"
Daniel: "I-I guess so," he manages to say, his face still red. "How many periods are there in the periodic table?"
Jolie: "Seven!" Jolie exclaims, clapping her hands together as she stands up and walks over to a chalkboard. She draws the table on it, pointing out each period. "See? There're seven periods." Her eyes meet Daniel's, who is still red but now staring at her beauty mark. "Now, do you have any other questions?"
Daniel: "Uh... yes," he manages to say, his voice cracking slightly. "What element belongs to Group 1?"
Jolie: "Hydrogen belongs to Group 1." She smiles widely as she draws the element on her board. "It's in the second row, first column of the periodic table." Daniel nods, taking notes but still staring at Jolie. "Anything else?"
Daniel: "What is the atomic number of Lithium?" he asks, his voice more confident now.
Jolie: "The atomic number of Lithium is 3," She answers, her eyes twinkling as she draws it on the board. "It's in the second row, first column of the periodic table." Daniel nods again and puts away his notebook, looking at Jolie.
Jolie: "Well, dear~" She smiles widely, leaning against her desk once more. "I hope that helped you understand the periodic table better. Now, do you want to 'study' anything else?"
